security: The text is redacted because the public disclosure of the redaction could reasonably be expected to constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, and that invasion of privacy would be so substantial that it outweighs the public interest.
summary: This document pertains to the payroll records of Barbara Jean Robinson, a researcher for the Martin Luther King Task Force, and includes information about her employment with the HSCA, effective dates, salary, and certifications.
summary_one_paragraph: This document consists of payroll authorization forms and related memoranda for Barbara Jean Robinson, who was employed as a researcher for the Martin Luther King Task Force within the U.S. House of Representatives. The forms detail her appointment, salary adjustments, and termination, including effective dates and gross annual salary, as well as certifications confirming she is not related to any current member of Congress. The document also includes a memorandum from I. Charles Mathews advising of Robinson's position and a notification about the payroll certification process.
title: Final Determination Notification & Payroll Authorization Forms for Barbara Jean Robinson
recipient: Clerk of the House of Representatives, Tom Howarth, All Staff
sender: HSCA, Louis Stokes, I. Charles Mathews
